Question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?

Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, low number of events.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding and lack of allocation concealment.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Very small sample size, low number of events.
Explanations.e: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Very small sample size.
Explanations.f: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.
Explanations.g: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, low number of events.

Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, low number of events.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding and lack of allocation concealment.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.
Explanations.e: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.

Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting benefit.
Explanations.b: The study Santos-Faria 2019 found that the RR of low disease activity assessed with Simplified Disease Activity Index ≤ 11 was 0.9 (95%CI 0.68 to 1.17), absolute risk reduction 69 per 1000 (95%CI 222 fewer to 118 more). The RR of low disease activity assessed with Clinical Disease Activity Index ≤ 10 was 0.88 (95%CI 0.68 to 1.15), absolute risk reduction 83 per 1000 (95%CI 222 fewer to 104 more).

Explanations.a: Downgraded by two levels due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding (except for radiographic outcomes) and lack of allocation concealment.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, very low number of events.
Explanations.e: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Very small sample size.
Explanations.f: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Very small sample size, very low number of events.
Explanations.g: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding of patients and personnel and lack of allocation concealment. Outcome assessors for radiographic outcomes were blinded.
Explanations.h: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Very small sample size.

Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment and lack of blinding.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Low sample size.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Low sample size.

Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting benefit.
Explanations.b: The study Santos-Faria 2019 found that the RR of low disease activity assessed with Simplified Disease Activity Index ≤ 11 was 0.72 (95%CI 0.49 to 1.06), absolute risk reduction 194 per 1000 (95%CI 354 fewer to 42 more). The RR of low disease activity assessed with Clinical Disease Activity Index ≤ 10 was 0.72 (95%CI 0.5 to 1.05), absolute risk reduction 194 per 1000 (95%CI 346 fewer to 35 more).
Explanations.c: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm.

References.1: Brown S, Everett CC, Naraghi. Alternative tumour necrosis factor inhibitors (TNFi) or abatacept or rituximab following failure of initial TNFi in rheumatoid arthritis: the SWITCH RCT. Health Technology Assessment (Winchester, England). 2018;22(34):1.
References.2: Manders SH, et al. Cost-effectiveness of abatacept, rituximab, and TNFi treatment after previous failure with TNFi treatment in rheumatoid arthritis: a pragmatic multi-centre randomised trial. BioMed Central. 2015;17.
